title.narrative: Support for church-led peacebuilding in South Sudan 2019-20

description.narrative: The project will be implemented by CA as lead agency in partnership with CAFOD and Trocaire in Partnership (CTP), working closely with the SSCC to support the APP, with other partners and technical experts providing expertise related to specific activities. The SSCC is an ecumenical body comprised of seven member churches (the biggest in South Sudan) and associate churches, building on a powerful legacy of peacebuilding, reconciliation and advocacy. Through its national secretariat (based in Juba), three regional offices (Bahr el Ghazal, Equatoria, Upper Nile), and community-level Inter-Church Committees (ICCs – with membership comprised of local representatives of member churches), it provides a multi-level platform to enable ecumenical cooperation. UK support in 18/19 enabled ICCs to form and become active in Aweil, Yirol, Rumbek, Malakal; regional ICCs to be reactivated in the three regions; scoping visits to expand the APP’s reach to Ganyiel, Nyal, Maban, Renk and Bor; and also enabled the reopening of the Malakal regional office following a process of reconciling divided and traumatised church leaders. The 2019-2020 project will enable scoping visits to new areas which are prone to conflict (see below), and support for the formation and reactivation of new ICCs in these locations. Conflict continues around Mundri, Yei, Maridi and in the border areas of Terekeka, and these areas do not yet have fully formed ICCs. Ecumenical cooperation already exists in some areas, for example in Yei where the local churches have been playing an important role in spearheading peace activities. ICCs will complement these existing intiatives, and provide further support, capacities and connectivity via SSCC structures.
